page.title: 05LAMPLUGH CARAVAN CLUB
page.content: The Caravan Club site is called Dockray Meadow. To use the site you have to be a member of the Caravan Club. The site is 20 years old. Caravans can only stay for 3 weeks. Of the 39 plots 6 have electricity. The site is open for 6 months: the week before Easter until the 7th of October. A stay of about 2 weeks for a family of four in the peak season costs about Â£30. The charge a night for the pitch is Â£1, adults pay 65p and children pay 30p. Out of season adults pay 45p, children pay 20p. A lot of people come a year after year. The milk costs 23p, eggs cost 94p and aqua kem costs Â£2.30. Aqua kem is a chemical that you put in your portable toilets. The heaviest caravan allowed on the site is 1 tonne. There are no toilets or showers in the camp unless you bring your own.
